Reviews.Title: “Excellent location! Our second stay - we will stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: 2travelinFoolz
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel go above and beyond to accommodate any needs you may have. They truly treat you like family. If you have something you would like to see, eat, or do - they will point you in the right direction! This is the Rome we were looking for... (we stay in a lot of chain hotels - so we try to look for other places to stay when we can.). This is the perfect "anti-chain! This hotel is old. We love it! The perfect hotel to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary! There are beautiful antiques and frescoes everywhere. Our room overlooked the garden. (The first time we stayed here we overlooked the garden and asked if we could do so again, and they accommodated our request.) Since this hotel is right on the road leading up to St. Peter's, there can be a lot of street noise, so if you can get a room that does not overlook the street, you'll probably be more likely to have a peaceful nights sleep. In the three years since we last visited, we can tell they have done some upgrades; for example the shower is more "American" thus giving you more space in the bathroom. Our room had a sitting area, and then a separate door leading to a very comfortable king sized bed and small closet. There was a TV in both the bedroom and living area, but we never turned it on - too busy touring!! :) This is a perfect location for us. We like being close to St. Peter's; as well as walking distance to many other attractions and churches. The ONLY negative thing I can think of would be relating to the restaurant. It is grossly overpriced; and when my husband asked for two separate dishes, they were "out of" both. Again, the staff was pleasant, but we only ate the one meal there. A very good wine list to select from though... All in all we were very pleased with our stay, can't wait to visit again, and to see a staff that treated us more like family than paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “"Wonderful Location"”
Reviews.Author: Ljmscope
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Columbus is very close to the Vatican, just steps away. The rooms are spartan - a bed, desk and chair. The location to the Vatican and the other sites around the city for us were great. At night, the street is quiet and then in the morning it explodes with life. The interior and the history of the building are remarkable. The front desk personnel made you feel comfortable and they were very accomodating. It is too bad there isn't free wi-fi but we purchased the one hour a day and that was enough for all four of us. Unfortunately, the beds are not comfortable but you can overlook that when staying in a wonderful city like Rome. There were four of us so we were given the "apartment" as they referred to it. Up on the 4th floor there is no view in the back unless you stood on the chair and looked out the window and into the interior courtyard. Really it was a nice stay and close to great neighborhoods for shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “An hotel with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Alexander D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Columbus is situated very close to the Vatican and St Peters is a two minute walk. It is an historic building well situated for seeing the sights of Rome, particularly the Vatican. The rooms are furnished in a rather old style which adds to the charm of the building. Some are small but contain all that is required. There is a lobby bar which is not staffed throughout the day but there is a bell system to call staff as required. The buffet breakfast is traditional continental with a good selection of meat, cheese, pastries etc. There is no lounge but throughout there are a number of seating areas. The lift is small and can be busy at times. There is an excellent restaurant. The front desk staff are very helpful and knowledgeable and will arrange airport transfer on request. This is very convenient and reasonably charged at Euro45 - saves all the trouble of taxi to the station and train to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Murano3
Reviews.Content: Had a nice long weekend staying at Hotel Columbus, the location is perfect for sight seeing, we were lucky enough to have a room the allowed us to see the Basicalli aswell as Catello Angelo. Room was basic but well equipped and very comfortable. A lovely period building with nice traditional Italian furniture, paintings and fitments. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: spiceisle3
Reviews.Content: It was just magical waking up to the singing of visitors on the night before Christmas. It was truly magical. We stayed at the Columbus Hotel steps away from the Vatican. We were able to open the window and listen to the midnight Mass and wake up with enough time to have breakfast and still get a nice position in front of the Church for the Pope Christmas address. The hotel itself accommodation was anything impressive. The room was small, but bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was so tiny you could not move around. We did not have the breakfast or dinner, the staff was pleasant, just could not get over the size of the room and bathroom. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Historic site, great location”
Reviews.Author: Eur0peanTravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the street leading directly to St. Peter's. The building was built around 660 ad and is owned by the Vatican. The rooms are large, although as with most 3 star hotels the furnishings are dated. We were not impressed with the breakfast - we felt it was over priced for a limited selection of continental breakfast items. I wanted a hotel near the Vatican because we were only staying a few days in Rome and wanted to make sure we could easily see the Sistine Chapel. To my surprise being close to the river made the hotel a great location to begin our walking tours of Rome. The coliseum is only a 45 minute walk away, with a number of very interesting sites along the way. The bus service is also very good from this location. A taxi ride from the main train station including luggage was 20 euros.

Reviews.Title: “A Historic Gem Steps from the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: MartiNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Columbus Hotel whenever in Rome. From some some of the rooms, you cen see the lit dome of St. Peter's through your window. It's just a block away from the Vatican, and is an ancient palace with large, lovely rooms, an elegant breakfast buffet that you can enjoy indoors or outside in their enclosed garden courtyard. It has its own parking lot (rare in central Rome!) and helpful staff. It is also right across the street from a "Hop on, Hop off" bus stop, so you can use a 24-hour or 48-hour ticket to tour the city all day and enjoy being picked up and dropped off right at your hotel. One block away, through the walls of the Vatican, are lovely authentic Italian restaurants with outdoor seating to enjoy the passers-by, including many of the nuns and priests in town on Vatican business.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like an very old roman fighter”
Reviews.Author: DetlevK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in the front of St Peter. 5 minutes walk to the entrance. An old building, the doors and windows protect you from wind but you here all noise from your neighbors, the street and even from the bathroom above yours. Not really relaxing times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - teensy room!”
Reviews.Author: OldMillAnna
Reviews.Content: The good news - this hotel is 100 metres from the Vatican and the common areas are quite regal. Great restaurant serving gourmet fare! The bad news - my room was like a monks room - very small, and sparse, lacking any charm - certainly unlike the august common areas of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Few Steps from Saint Peter's Cathedral”
Reviews.Author: Basten05
Reviews.Content: Arrive to Rome Int. Airport. Took the train to the Termini, took the Metro to one of the stations close to the Vatican, and arrive extremely tired. Great surprise on the location of the hotel, better than I thought, great rooms, great service. Will be back soon

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Louinsdf
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the Columbus. Although our double room was small, the twin room we had booked for our nieces was very large. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, even to the point of looking up directions to a restaurant to which they were unaware. I would use the Columbus again, especially for anyone wanting to be close to the Vatican. It's right outside the front door!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it,great location,great historical building,great people”
Reviews.Author: capousa
Reviews.Content: I changed my Hotel to this one, i could see vatican from my room, great building, i loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand and yet personal”
Reviews.Author: vangie1
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel within steps of the Vatican. There is an interior courtyard for breakfast and dinner (do eat dinner here - it was the best we had in Rome). We stayed in the Apartment and it was very nice, two rooms and a bath. A few down sides - The shower was difficult to manage, with no shower curtain and it being hand held. You had to pay extra for WiFi. The rooms were a little hot. Some front desk personel were more helpful than others (apparently there is a bus ticket you can get that lets you use the bus system but we were never told about it) Still, it was a charming oasis in a thriving metropolis.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, but super excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BigAL90275
Reviews.Content: Hotel was first completed in 1526. I stayed three very hot August nights, but the air conditioning worked GREAT all three days and nights. Hotel has three advantages: Location, location, location. The front door is about 350 feet from the edge of St. Peter's Square. All of the tour buses stop directly across the street. Service was generally good. All staff members spoke good English. Internet is for a fee from two computers in the lobby -- one of which did not work two of the days I stayed there. My room was small, adequate and very overpriced. The bathroom was comical. No bathtub and no shower curtain. Before you take a shower, you have to remove everything from the bathroom that you don't want to get wet. The bathroom reflects the hotel's 16th century history. All things considered, my stay at the Columbus Hotel was a pleasant experience, but badly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Tired rooms - poor service”
Reviews.Author: chester030 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the desk clerk remarked that I had last stayed at the hotel in 2004. By the time I checked out I had been reminded why I had not stayed there for so long! The room was very tired, the carpet worn & stained. The decor was very dated - the bathroom was not 4****, the tiles were mismatched & cracked. The whole thing was very tacky. The room was in the eaves of the building - up a flight of stairs! (I was not told this at the desk) the two windows were the size of an A4 sheet of paper - no view then! The service, if it could be called that, at breakfast was perfunctory at best.. I had to ask three times for a plate on which to put my self service breakfast. By the time plates arrived there was a queue waiting for them! All in all, this hotel is in dire need of refurbishment - and staff training - it was NOT worth £149 for a room!

Reviews.Title: “This place could be a fantastic five-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: kostyalevin
Reviews.Content: Sadly, it's not. I stayed at Columbus hotel for two nights in June 2011 for a business trip. The hotel has a great location as it is very close to the Vatican (2 min on foot). It is also not far to the other major sights in Rome. The building is absolutely stunning. It is easily 400 years old, has high ceilings, large staircases, and the public areas are lavishly decorated. The rooms are also quite large and feature full bathrooms. They have free parking and a nice garden area where guests can take their breakfast. This is where the positive aspects cease. Some points that annoyed me during my stay were: - the room's decor was beyond spartan. The furniture, most notably the beds, were just old (the mattresses were OK, though). There was also a total lack of any decoration to make the room seem more inviting. - the walls were paper thin; I could hear Mike & Linda's conversations every morning from their room next to mine. - the air conditioning only works on certain time slots; the evening shift was from 2000 - 2400, for example. - the bathroom was very dark. They had to actually screw a spotlight next to the mirror so that guests could shave. - I'm certain the desk chair dated from the hotel's inauguration. I almost fell through it sitting on it. As a caveat to the above, I'd like to say that my colleague had a much better experience than me, so I might just have had bad luck. All in all, the hotel's OK if you really need a hotel near the Vatican. It's a shame, as the hotel has truly incredible potential to really offer a five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel in Vatican Area”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas1482
Reviews.Content: My suggestion is to not stay at this hotel. Here are my reasons: First, I had to switch rooms because the air conditioner (installed high up above the doorway) produced only hot air. (I stayed here June 1-8, 2011). One front desk staff person told me that the air conditioner worked like a central air unit, and only produced cold air from 8AM-12PM, then another staff member said it was 8PM to 12AM. I didn't believe either, but went along with it so they would let me switch rooms, which they did the next day because they themselves realized, after visiting me, that it was very hot and uncomfortable. After switching, the new air conditioner worked fine as well as all the time. So why did they lie? (I later learned that I wasn't the only guest of the hotel who had the same problem - but I don't know whether his issue was resolved.) Second, the plumbing in the second room (especially the toilet) didn't work properly. The toilet paper wouldn't go down - bad water pressure, I assume - and the hotel wouldn't fix it. After telling them about it for the third time, they told me to flush the toilet as may times as it took until the paper went down. (Who would say that?) Every morning I left it, thinking that the maids who clean the room would deal with it, but they didn't - they just closed the lid. What did I do after that? You don't want to know. I tried to switch hotels but the eight hotels I called were booked due to the national holiday taking place during my week's stay. Good luck to all who venture here...

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Vatican enthusiasts”
Reviews.Author: katelynlouise
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the street with the most beautiful view of St. Peter's Basilica. Rome is fairly spead out, so it is tough to choose a central location, but Hotel Columbus has access to all the buses. It is an older builiding and seems to attract a lot of priests and nuns who are not staying in Vatican City. The rooms were TINY, the bathroom was smaller than I knew was possible, and the air conditioning didn't work very well. However, the courtyard is AMAZING. The servers bring out yummy (and free) little trays of appertivos with any drinks. Hotels in Rome can be more expensive, and this probably worked out well compared to other hotels for the price.

Reviews.Title: “great base to stay when in Rome”
Reviews.Author: brian_cairney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is authentic and has good character about it...the rooms were comfortable and airy with old style furniture. My only gripe would be the size of the shower cubilcle. The dining room was beautiful and the food was great...all the staff that we met were courteous and polite. The hotel is a great base for the Vatican as it is less that 500 yards to St Peters Square and is in easy walking distance of about 15/20 mins away from some of the other historic attractions. The area where the hotel is on is very quiet at night which was nice in a bustling city like Rome not too much traffic outside the hotel at night.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable location”
Reviews.Author: Mudgedog
Reviews.Content: The Columbus Hotel situated 100 mtrs from the Vatican. so close in fact that the restaurant of the hotel was once used as the refectory in which the Pope took meals!. (check out the frescos). As I only required a single room the room I was allocated was exactly that! A single bed had been shoe horned into the room which had a tiny window looking onto a side street (so no views)...this really was a priests cell! and very basic. The only sound which could be heard from the outside was of singing pilgrims. The larger rooms of the hotel have better views and are a lot less basic, and a lot more expensive.! Dinner in the hotel restaurant is a must, excellent food and surroundings. If your main reason to be in Rome is to spend a lot of time in and near the Vatican this is the place for you. The Parthenon and other Rome sites are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “a welcoming palace on the steps of St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: loveParis18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 15th century palazzo located 500 feet from the plaza in front of St Peters! The noise and bustle of the street stops at the hotel's doors and once inside you get a glimpse at medieval princely lodgings: hugely tall, painted-ceilinged halls, thick walls, huge leaded windows and castlelike drapery. The rooms range from smaller at the 4th floor to really large at the lower floors, but all well appointed. Bathroom facilities are mostly updated but even those that keep the flair of time passed are in very good working order and very comfortable. The staff is very courteous and friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The reception staff distinguish themselves by speaking very well several European languages and take the trouble to know their customers by name. The restaurant is in a museum quality room all frescoed and high; one wouldn't be surprised to see Romeo and Juliet walk in, or a knight in armor! Service is very pleasant and understated, food is sophisticated 21st century elegant fare, the same about the wine list.

Reviews.Title: “A near perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: PhilHuff
Reviews.Content: Expectations of the Columbus were mixed. Good reviews appear here on TripAdvisor, but a low price combined with a central Rome location with parking rang alarm bells. My concern was totally misplaced, as the Columbus is a truly fantastic hotel. Literally a stones throw from Vatican City, the location couldn't be better for visitors there. For the rest of Rome, it meant a short walk, but Castel Sant'Angelo is just a couple of minutes walk, while Piazza Navona is around 15 minutes. Even the Colosseum is walkable, taking a leisurely 40 minutes to get to. However, given the hotels position, right on the approach to the Vatican, taxis are plentiful. The hotel itself has a small car park, through a narrow gate, which is unusual in Rome. The building itself is unremarkable although pleasant, but once you get inside it's fantastic! A large reception area with stone floors, high ceilings and endless old artworks on the wall greets you. This theme is continued throughout the hotel, with random lounges, reception rooms, seating areas and more, all very grand. There's even a grand piano lurking in one room, perfectly tuned. A spacious bar, with Wi-Fi, and a classy restaurant are available too, with the latter serving some fantastic, if pricey, food. The room was very spacious, although somewhat basic. That said, it fitted the style of the hotel perfectly, where a modern identikit hotel room would have felt out of place. A large bed, plenty of floor space, a desk and a TV balanced on top of a mini-bar made up the room, while the bathroom had a good, powerful shower and again, plenty of space. Air conditioning was available, but some vented window shutters proved more pleasant, allowing you to keep the fierce summer sun out during the day, but allowing fresh air in. In a world of identical chain hotels, the Columbus somehow felt 'real'. When we'd got back each day from exploring Rome, we still felt like we were in Rome, not a faceless hotel. Given that, most flaws could have been overlooked, and possibly were, because as far as we were concerned the hotel was as near perfect as you could get. Brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Unique”
Reviews.Author: Sllm33
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Columbus in the Carnival weekend betwen the 5 and 8 of March and find the Hotel quite unique. For an old 15th century monk convent we find everything quite excellent. The room for us was the number 340 facing the yard. A very quiet room that provide us 3 very good sleeping nights with an excellent bathroom with hot, hot water an extra, extra large and confort king size bed and hot hot ac. The cleaness of the hotel was excellent with every corner quite, quite clean as our room too, every day. Good breakfast with many options, very very nice staff, specially "Alexandro" the recepcionist. At last, but not least the "terrific" location just outside Vatican city. Not so good, the quality of furniture, needing to be replace, The super expensive prices at hotel restaurant "La Veranda" ( but still quite gorgeous), an expresso 2,5€!!! And the TV chanells, only ten, and some with very poor quality! Allthough the very negative comments here in this site, wich almost made us to avoid this Hotel, believe me, one should book this Hotel, because it´s EXCELLENT service So beautifull and TERRIFIC located!!! Loved the experience! Loved Columbus! Loved Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Know what you want.”
Reviews.Author: imtoast
Reviews.Content: I think the best word to sum up this hotel is "unique." It is not glamorous, posh, or trendy. But it is exactly what I wanted in visiting Rome for the first time. I spent 5 nights at Columbus in May '10, and I chose it because it offered a great combination of location, value, and historic flavor. As you have read or will shortly, the building itself is wonderful in the sense that it drips with history - a former monestary, it sits between St. Peter's Square and the Ponte Sant'Angelo - and with a good throw you could probably get a stone to either. There are paintings throughout the hotel that are hundreds of years old, and the large shady courtyard with center fountain is splendid (especially in the early eveing with a glass of wine). This alone is reason for many, including myself, to love the place - that feeling of staying within proximity of so much amazing history. But again, know what you want. If for you it's more about ammenities, service, etc, then there will be higher-rated options. Some potential drawbacks: the rooms are plain at best - if you travel to Rome so that you can spend a lot of time in your room then choose another hotel (although the monks that once slept in them would be impressed). Also the hotel is not very near an underground rail station, so i walked a ton. I stayed on the courtyard side so sleep was fine, but careful if you're on the street leading to the Vatcian because I understand it can be quite noisy. Breakfast was fine - not fancy, but satisfactory with cereal, yogurt, cakes, ham, cheese, and good coffee. Sorry, can't comment on the restaurant for dinner, other than it's pricey and in a beautiful room. The service/staff? Fine overall. Some very polite, some not so much, but never rude. There was a misunderstanding which caused a mid-stay move to a smaller room, but I was fine with it - in fact I had a double room to myself for two nights at a single price, and they let it slide. Bottom line: I would be very happy to stay there again. For you history pilgrims out there, I hope you enjoy this hotel as much as i did.

Reviews.Title: “A super location with a marvelously helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Jim1UD
Reviews.Content: We initially wanted to be near the Spanish Steps. But we ended up here and loved it. The hotel is just down the street from St. Peter's and is part of an old palace and school. Talk about living in luxury. To me, what made our stay special was the helpful front desk, especially Stephania and Najeh. They cordially responded to every request -- whether it was for directions to a restaurant, to a nearby tourist site, to a retail location or anything else. When friends we were with and I could not seem to confirm our plane reservation, Najeh did it for us. The view of gardens out our hotel window was fabulous. The breakfasts were plentiful and served in elegant surroundings. And having a pre-dinner drink on the veranda was lovely. If you are looking for huge rooms, spacious showers and American-size elevators, you won't find it here. But if you are looking for a marvelous stay in a beautiful area of Rome, consider coming to the Columbus Hotel. And enjoy some of the best, friendliest service I have enountered anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, terrible beds.”
Reviews.Author: Double_helix_01
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is a stone's throw from the Vatican and Castel Sant'Angelo. However, it seems in Rome you can have location or comfort, not both. The beds were only slightly more comfortable than an operating table. On the plus side I now know that I can sleep in a casket if it's ever required. The hotel is a bit of a labyrinth, and really interesting with lots of nooks and crannies. We had a room for three, and that meant it was two small attached rooms, one with a large king and one with two double. The room with the double beds had French doors so it was a bit loud when there were people in the hall outside, but it's not like the hotel was full of coeds so it was sufficient quiet for our needs. The room had a bonus of the most awful chairs in the history of the universe. It was satisfying to to encounter the worst and second worst chairs on earth. There was wifi available but it was not free, and had to be purchased by the hour. We found that this was really not unusual in Europe, and that free wifi or internet was not readily available. Now you may be wondering how this hotel could possibly be recommended. Well, if location is important to you, than this is the hotel for you. The view was amazing, and the staff was great, and arranged for a really nice car for us to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “safe and clean, close to st peters”
Reviews.Author: charlieclaire
Reviews.Content: it was ok. it was clean and big and pretty and close to st peters. but FAR from everything else. i prefered other places in the middle of the city. it gets pretty dark and lonely at night in that area. beds were umcomfortable and the 4 -person suit ewas a bed, a twin couch roll out, and a rolled in twin bed. so the 2 little bed couldn't even be moved together. breakfast was good, if the pigeons dont' eat it first. little pricey considering i had better elsewhere with better location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, indifferent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Porters46
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a 15th century building previously used to house priests and is still very austere. The location is brilliant being 100 metres from St Peter's Square, although bus and metro connections are not so good. Local restaurants are mainly tourist oriented bu adequate. The restaurant in the hotel is beautiful but very expensive.The rooms are slightly worn with only a single small lift serving them which was not totally reliable. The staff were helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel as advertised”
Reviews.Author: lelash
Reviews.Content: I was terribly disappointed with this hotel. It was dismal and dark and the first room that was shown to us smelled awful and the carpets were thread bare and dirty. We looked at 5 diifferent rooms before we settled on the best of the worst. The air conditioner didnt work and they never did anything about it. This hotel reminded me of a run down rooming house. I would never stay here again or suggest anyone else to stay here. While we visited Rome, we looked at other four star hotels but unfortunately they were booked, but they were so much nicer than the Columbus Hotel and less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Location, will go back one day!”
Reviews.Author: DJ04
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, well kept for its age, nice set up resturant, enjoyed the breakfast, the check in was fast and easy, they even prepared us breakfast pack to go the day we were leaving, was too early.

Reviews.Title: “love the location”
Reviews.Author: DesiW
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 6 nights, a family of six and we had a wonderful time in Rome. the vatican was just a stone throw away and it only takes five minutes walk to the bus stop where we can take bus 64 or 40 to go to other places. it is also walking distance to castel s angelo. the staff they were very friendly, room service was very good, they changed the sheets and towels everyday but the carpets are old and dirty and the sofas at the lounge downstair needs upholsteries. Desiree Wong from Malaysia

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: RATSOMATIC
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the terrible reviews I was all set to try and change our booking but didn't and was glad. From the outside it looks a bit shabby but inside it is well decorated. Yes it's quite dark and even a bit gloomy in places but remember you are staying a centuries old building, not a modern soulless place. Our room wasn't huge but large enough for three of us for a few nights. The furniture is dark and heavy, but it is in keeping with the building - flat pack furniture would look ridiculous. It faced the front but wasn't particularly noisy. The bathroom was clean and modern. We had breakfast on the terrace and the food was standard fare - cereal, breads, cakes, cheese, cold meats etc. Not a lot of fresh fruit which was a shame. Location is great - either walked or got open-topped bus. All in all, absolutely fine.

Reviews.Title: “For what we paid we were pleasantly...”
Reviews.Author: hungrytraveler0
Reviews.Content: For what we paid we were pleasantly surprised. Just down from the Vatican, this historical building has frescoes, long hallways that house rooms that look out on the garden and many public spaces to hang out. Dinner was excellent and the wine list very good. Make sure your room is on garden side...the street can be lively. Although the neighborhood goes to sleep with the Pope evidently...if you want to be near the Vatican you can't do better for the price. We had some glitches but nothing huge. They should make sure the laundry keeps up with towels. The dining room has frescoes and floor lamps, and is romantic without being stuffy. There is a garden for breakfast and dinner dining. Fig tree, Rosemary bush and olive trees keep it lovely. We were anxious about AC since Rome is hot but it worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible air conditioning made for an awful stay”
Reviews.Author: FrancophileLeanne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 18 days in Italy, and, by far, this was the worst of the six hotels we stayed out. The hotel itself was very nice and just two minutes from St. Peter's, but the heat was in the high 90's in July, and the air conditioner in our room didn't work. When we asked at the front desk about it, the person who worked there was extremely rude and told us that it wasn't broken and that that was the way that air conditioners are in Italy. Well, none of the other hotels we stayed at had that problem. The room was so hot that we couldn't sleep; my travel alarm clock has a thermometer on it, and our last night there, it said that the room was 86 degrees F. Overall, the location was nice (on the same street as St. Peters, so close to the Vatican and not too far if you plan to walk to other areas), but the room itself was hot, cramped, dark, and miserable. I would not recommend staying here, especially during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “location brilliant. service brilliant. could do with a face lift”
Reviews.Author: gmcf
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during our wedding. Wedding reception held in the garden and in la Veranda restaurant. Only 10 of us and the meal was one of the best I have ever had. It is a very old building so you cannot expect all the facilities of a brand new hotel. That said it could do with some updating. Staff were attentive and made our day very special.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 STARS FOR THE PRICE OF A 5 STARS...”
Reviews.Author: RobiOne
Reviews.Content: I spent a few nights at Hotel Columbus for work reasons, as our organization was invited by the Holy See for our annual meeting and the meeting rooms were a few steps from the hotel. When my colleagues and I arrived at the hotel very late at night we were puzzled by the beauty of the location and the public areas. The hotel is located in the Palazzo Della Rovere and frescos and paintings are just amazing! The waitress at the restaurant told us that it would be possible to sit at LA VERANDA RESTAURANT for an open air late dinner and we appreciated the originality of salads, fine wines and desserts. The very good news was that we would have breakfast al fresco every morning in a nice garden in the heart of the Vatican City… We woke up from our dream when we reached our rooms…Oh Gosh! Those whose rooms gave on the private garden could experience some peace and quiet but mine (206-207) gave on the via della Conciliazione…Impossible to sleep with an open window, the double glazing was faulty, I had no air conditioning…shall I go on? To talk about more “superficial” aspects, the furniture was old, damaged, the bathroom was tiny, the general aspect of the room pretty sinister, not to mention the fact that I had a condemned door in my room leading to...I will never know! The doors were old and damaged by heavy key rings. I didn’t imagine complaining: the hotel was full and having visited some other rooms I thought I was quite lucky (although room 218 was not bad: quite, with antique furniture). When I spoke to our communication representative she said that even the suites were in a hell of a state, so… The positive points about the rooms are that they are very clean and the mattress is good quality The staff in the hotel and restaurant is very friendly and efficient. At the end of the day, when you travel for work, this is the most important think. But since it’s not very common to travel to the Vatican for work reasons unless you are a priest, what would I recommend? To skip the hotel Columbus, maybe stay at the Hotel dei Consoli or Hotel Bramante and go to the Columbus to have lunch, dinner or simply a drink (there is a very nice barmaid who makes very tasty cocktails with fresh fruit!): for the price of the rooms you would expect a 4 stars and you get a 2 stars…The Columbus needs a good refurbishing but when, since it is always full?

Reviews.Title: “noisy airconditioner - dont expect to sleep well”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: The airconditioner was very noisy and old. Don't expect a good night's sleep. Rooms are motel like with very basic beds. Cement floor baths. If not for the location next to the Vatican it really is in dire need of a spruce up.

Reviews.Title: “Location location, but much is left to be desired”
Reviews.Author: JanniDKcph
Reviews.Content: We stay at this grand hotel in june 2010. First impression, it is very good, beautiful reception, hallways, restaurant and public areas. Our room on the the other hand was truly not up to standard. The room seemed old and used, alot scuff of marks along side the walls, the tv must be 20 years old. One could not read the button on the remote, due to wear, the picture too was really poor. But worst of all was the the bath room. Tiles were broken, and the was mildew/fungus on the wall. To top it all off there were several long black hair in the shower. The dinner restaurant was nice, very good personnel but the menu was a pit pretentious. "Nouvelle Italian cousine" I would call it. Some may like it, others definitely not.. Kids sure wont. Was actually bothers me the most was the fire exit signing, or rather lack there of. Some signs would lead you to dead ends, other would simple make no sense. A sure death trap in case of an emergency, especially if the lights would go out too..... Upon check out I pointed out my obervatons, including the poorly cleaned room, the mildew, and broken tiles. And the response was just to repeat what I said. No, " we are sorry to hear that" or "thank you for bringing this to our attention", or a least to comp the beer from the minibar ect....nothing, now that s truly poor service... That said, location is almost everything...... Almost.....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, full of history. Don't leave valuables in the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: italytraveller18
Reviews.Content: I really loved the hotel. A few problem with the drainage in the bathroom. It flooded. Lovely restaurant. Not cheap though. So close to the Vatican and local restaurants. Has to be the smallest lift in the building I have ever been in. Three people is a squeeze. The third floor carpets do need replacing. My wife had three bottles of perfume taken from her bag. We can't prove it, but I know it was the cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: andrearbedoya
Reviews.Content: The hotel's customer service was nonexistent. The clerks and bellhops were rude, stand-offish and completely unhelpful. The rooms were a disgusting mess of filthy carpets and moth-eaten blankets. The bathrooms were a disgrace; showering consisted of me utilizing the complimentary plastic cup as a makeshift bucket to wash my hair. The hotel's only saving grace is that it is located one block from the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: Oberst06
Reviews.Content: As others have commented the location is superlative for the Vatican. The hotel itself is an old quite substantial structure once owned by the Della Rovere family and now the property of the Equestrian Order of the Holy Sepulchre, given to them by the Pope, but is currently operated by a third party under a management contract that expired in 2007 and was in litigation thereafter. Assuming a new management firm takes over it is likely that the entire facility will be renovated and upgraded to a standard more in keeping with the location. Certainly there is plenty to work with, and, as others have commented the rooms are in need of it. Our room the first night overlooked the courtyard (a plus) but was small. The sink and shower leaked and the A/C didn't work. When asked, the clerk at the front desk said that A/C wasn't turned on until June 15, but, oddly, the A/C in the room of the other couple we were travelling with worked just fine; each room appears to have its own unit. A call to our travel agent in Rome resulted in us being moved down the hall to a much larger room where the A/C worked perfectly. The beds were comfortable, the staff was helpful in giving directions and in making dinner reservations, and there is a nice bar in the courtyard. While there you'll look around and say to yourself, "This has the potential to be turned into something really special" and then thinking about how you'd do it. When the reality catches up with the contemplation of things to be done it will be far more than just a good venue.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbus - great location, marvelous staff, extradordinary amenities.”
Reviews.Author: JJNN
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled to Rome the end of May and our first hotel stay was the Hotel Columbus. The hotel was elegant and stately with old world charm. We loved it. The staff were great, there was a very reasonable airport limousine service, and they went out of their way to welcome us. The Veranda Restaurant at the hotel was a fabulous place to drink in the scenery, and local sites. Walking distance to St. Peter's and the Vatican, it was an ideal location. The breakfast that came with our room reservation was so good, and nutritious. The coffee is exceptional! In addition, the Hotel is a historic building and the Vatican Apartments are near. Lunching and dining with religious men and women from the vatican, and students, scholars and artists was really fascinating. We loved this hotel with it's beautiful works of art. I believe that it was once the place where priests lived when they came to Rome. I The rooms are very lovely and the windows are huge and open like shutters and you can lean on your windowsill and look out. Very charming. I am not sure if there was air conditioning, probably was, but we didn't turn it on. We stayed four nights - three at the beginning of our trip and our last night in Italy. Both times we loved our rooms. I still haven't quite figured out the elevator numbering system, but we managed to muddle through it! The staff at the Hotel Columbus were very kind, considerate and helpful. They never seemed to get up tight no matter how many people were asking questions, calling on the phone, or requesting services all at the same time! I would go back to this hotel and recommend it to anyone wanting a relaxing, comfortable and clean room with a location handy for everything you might want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: CraighallMK
Reviews.Content: I find that this is a strange review to write - this hotel is not perfect but my friends and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here (4 nights) and I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone I know. It is set in a historic building in a fantastic location - just outside St Peter's. The restaurant is beautiful and the atmosphere is very friendly and comfortable. We found the staff very helpful and the hotel is kept exceptionally clean. Our rooms were very comfortable - one had a small bath, whilst the other had a shower. Whilst they are spartan and could do with some refurbishment - they are clean, spaceous and with sufficient storage for 4 women who do not know when to stop packing. The rooms will not suit those who like a plush environment - perhaps they should go elsewhere. Breakfast was basic but substantial enough to set you up for the day - ham, cheese, eggs, bread, cake, juice, coffee and tea etc. We did not eat in the restaurant as it appeared expensive - but there are so many other places to eat in Rome this was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location but dreadful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Keo3107
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel. The location is fantastic, just a stone's throw from St Peters and the Vatican and everywhere else is easily accesible by tour buses (available from across the road from the hotel) and the metro. The hotel itself blows you away with the history and ambience however the minute I walked into my room I was disappointed. I had a single room but it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. (Felt like a cell which in it's time it may well have been a monks room!) They had crammed dark wood old furniture in which made it appear even smaller. Even in March the room was red hot and the air con didn't work and it was too noisy to keep the windows open. The bathroom needed updating and the sink was actually in the bedroom. (not pleasant). I struggled to find space to put my stuff as there was no dressing table, just a shelf above the sink. The furnishings were old, dark and tired and the room was quite depressing. Like someone else said when you look at the website the rooms look fab but the reality is not the same. There's one old lift that wasn't very reliable and fit only 4 people in at one time and though we found the service to be friendly it was incredibly slow. Breakfast was adequate but why they have to put out tinned fruit cocktail when Italy has access to such wonderful fresh fruit was beyond me! (We actually saw oranges growing on trees in the city centre so it wasn't that they were in short supply!) Overall I'd say this hotel is very average however the location does it a huge favour. I wouldn't want to spoil the history and ambience but the rooms defintely need updating so that they all reflect what is shown on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; lukewarm toward guests and filthy carpets”
Reviews.Author: cubamom
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel for its location and proximity to the Vatican. It sits on a beautiful street and is located within the palace of the cardinal who became pope and commissioned Micahelangelo to paint the Sistine Chapel. Our room was large by European standards and was a triple. The bathroom was modern, did not contain a shower, thus you sat in the tub or filled it for your bath. The tile was damaged in sections, but the bathroom was very clean with no mold. Our beds were comfortable and clean. The problem: the carpet was disgusting and filthy! I've stayed in third world countries with cleaner carpets. The pink carpet displayed a clear trail of filth into the room and around each bed, tracking the walking patterns. I thought perhaps this was just our room, but I got a peek at the room across from us and its carpet was exactly the same. We had to use the hotel slippers provided. Lastly, the reception service varied widely. Our first morning we had to be at the coliseum at 8 a.m. and so at 7 a.m. we asked the front desk to hail us a cab. They told us to walk the two-three blocks to the taxi stand. We did and found that at that time, not a single cab was to be found. We began the walk to the coliseum on our own until we eventually found a cab. As my daughter in an ortho boot for a fractured leg we were trying to restrict her amount of walk, thus the need for a cab. We were disappointed upon our return to the hotel to find them gladly hailing cabs for other guests. And, our first evening we asked the hotel to recommend a nearby restaurant. They sent us to a self-service counter a block away were a terrible counter meal cost us $100!! The few times we approached the counter to ask questions, we found we were simply wasting our time. Luckily, we'd hired a private guide for our first two mornings in Rome and SHE provided us with all the information we needed. Would I recommend the hotel, yes for its location. If you can't live with filthy carpets (which I found difficult to do for the price of hotel) don't stay here. If you do stay here, you may or may not receive front office help when you have questions. Breakfast was GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant experience”
Reviews.Author: LilianM3
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay..a bit out of town but can connect easily with public transport....nice quiet, hotel, can breath nice clean and fresh air ....much needed freshness when on holiday..highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Palatial vs Luxurious Accommodations near the Vatican.”
Reviews.Author: MLBguy
Reviews.Content: This centuries old former palace is a one of a kind. Although my standard room was hardly stylish, it did have windows that opened on the grand boulevard that leads to the Vatican. I felt like a visiting country priest in the 1950s. But the old worn carpet was real clean and a large built-in armoire was neat. The one tiny elevator would never be acceptable for a property this size in the USA. Again, this is Europe and this is an historic building. The public rooms were stunning. I enjoyed the staff. They were helpful with restaurants and my minimum Italian. Breakfast was above average for a continental breakfast as it had many choices of treats. They even surprised me with a bag of goodies when I had to leave early one morning and would have missed breakfast. Taxi drivers always knew exactly where I needed to go when I said Hotel Columbus!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbus - beautiful building, adequate rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rwilkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Columbus on 12/17-12/20, again 12/24 and 12/25 and again 12/28 and 12/29. Hotel was happy to hold luggage for us at no charge as we travelled to Florence and to Viterbo where my son attends university. The hotel is beautiful with lovely common rooms. My daughter played the grand piano in the grand salon, empty except for the piano and a beautiful Christmas tree, and we enjoyed the creche and other Christmas trees and decorations in other common rooms. It is a former monastery and is austere but beautiful. Rooms (we stayed in 4 over our various nights so had a good idea of what they were like in general) were plain. Old tv sets, plastic lamps on the nightstands, some bathrooms more spacious than others. One room had a bathroom with a shower off to the side so you showered in the room itself (kinda wet but the kids enjoyed it.) Rooms facing the main street are fairly noisy so ask for a room facing the courtyard if you think it may disturb your sleep. Hotel staff is polite, not friendly, but always polite. I have read other reviews complaining about hotel breakfasts in Italy and every hotel we stayed in appears to have the same basic breakfast - and it was far more enjoyable and varied than what I expected: eggs (hardboiled), meats and cheeses, yoghurt, fruit (canned), cakes, breads, croissants, etc., in a beautiful dining room. Location is amazing if you are interested in visiting the Vatican. For us to visit over Christmas and stroll a block to St. Peter's to receive the papal blessing on Christmas Day - awesome. Of course, if you are visiting Rome, you should not miss St. Peter's. But - this hotel is a bit out of the way for the rest of Rome's favorite tourist haunts. It was fine for us as my son knows his way around the Metro and the bus stops (I believe it is the #62 that stops barely a half block from the hotel and winds its way around Rome.) One last thing, lunches and dinners at the hotel were amazingly expensive and we were used to the expensive food in general in Rome. Perhaps it was the Christmas holiday time but dinner was 105 euros per person and lunch was not a whole lot less. We did not eat at the restaurant because of the cost but we did stop in for a late night drink one night and it was a beautiful place, they treated us to cookies with our drinks and it was a lovely time. Just don't expect posh rooms even though this is a 4 star hotel and you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely atmosphere-ideal location-helpful and charming staff”
Reviews.Author: kdlbs
Reviews.Content: Very good value for hotel just steps away from St. Peter's. Two of us in a room with 4 beds. Decent size shower and generous supply of fluffy towles,slippers and toiletries. Minibar/fridge had decent selection of snacks and drinks at a reasonable price. Breakfast - good selection,only one suggestion would be that they could offer fresh fruit. Public rooms very tasteful and inviting.Booked day trip with Greenline tours at front desk and as we were being picked up at 7am hotel arranged breakfast box for us. Taxi organised by gentleman at desk,cost 45 euros which was very good considering it cost us 60 euros from airport to hotel. All staff very well mannered, pleasant and helpful. Tourist bus stops just across from hotel.Worth buying 48hr ticket for 110 open plus archeobus for 30euros. Eating out-worth a ten minute stroll away from hotel area. Try Da Mario Trattoria -Via della Chiesa Nuova for good food at sensible prices.Best ice cream-Old Bridge just off Piazza de Risorgimento. Stock Chic outlets have great clothes at discount prices-Piazza di Spagna or Via Catullo. Over 65 EU citizen show passport to get free access to some museums-Castel Sant Angelo being one. Also free entry to Vatican last Sunday of every month-get there very early.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdt47
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect because of mixed reviews, We found the hotel to be exactly what we were looking for in Rome. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel had a museum feel about it that was beautiful. The location was a block from St Peters Bascilica and convienent to public transportation and walking to other attractions. The breakfast was good. The mattresses were a little hard but after a long day it still felt good. It was very peaceful to be able to walk up to St Peters square at night when it was empty and just sit there and take it in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, elegant historic palazzo.”
Reviews.Author: pagh
Reviews.Content: One of best location (especially for first time in Rome and interest in Vatican), historic building, however, if arriving early, advisable not take the "available" ready rooms, or, you might be in attic like rooms (roomy and clean) with small high windows, taking away half the beauty of location. Most staff greatly helpful, particularly a "special Stefania" who is (in my opinion) a great asset to the hotel! Difficulties using Wi-Fi, but two computers at reception can be helpful. Restaurant on premise very good, great staff and beautiful location overlooking parklike courtyard. Some of public rooms just stunning! My only regret is to have taken the "available" early rooms! Would have loved to gaze out the windows onto the Vatican cupolas. A definite return for us.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 15th century former palazzo in a magnificant area.”
Reviews.Author: marpatAustralia
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Columbus Hotel in early October. We were fortunate to have a room overlooking the street and could peer out the window and see St Peters and the piazza. The public rooms are magnificant and although the furnishings and decor of our room were outdated they were perfectly adequate and the bed was the most comfortable of our stay in Italy. The breakfast was the usual Italian basic buffet. The bonus of the area is everyone leaves the area by evening and it is very quiet, even the church bells didn't start on Sunday until about 8.00am. I had previously stayed at the hotel 40 years ago whilst travelling alone using "Europe on $5 Day" - no ensuite then.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be deceived by the location!”
Reviews.Author: mousey79
Reviews.Content: We had a two nights stay at Hotel Columbus and it was nightmarish!The hotel is grim and dull and the ambiance reminded me of a haunted house. The breakfast is nothing great and the plates are dirty!The AC leaked, water in the sink overflowed,mosquitoes bit me throughout the night, and the bathroom had dangerous steps which weren't even aesthetically pleasing. I am glad we were out of the hotel most times for sightseeing and I actually dreaded going back to the room at night. We booked it for it's location and frankly it's the only reason it's doing well. The staff acted like zombies. I had to call thrice to get tissues to my room and they acted as if I had asked for marijuana!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MikeandPippa
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and both visits have been excellent. Close to the Vatican, you can here the crowds in St Peter’s square and the bells if you leave your window open. The staff are friendly and welcoming, the rooms clean and the restaurant well worth visiting. There is an outside terrace for breakfast, drinks and dinner and the courtyard creates a quite and peaceful setting in the middle of a busy city. The rooms may be considered a little small for some and darkly decorated, but it is a well-run hotel in a good location with lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Charming historical hotel with fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: sixfootsid
Reviews.Content: Lovely medieval building which has been converted into a charming hotel. Lots of comfortable sitting areas throughout the hotel, many with fabulous views across the rooftops. Beautiful vaulted ceiling in the restaurant (La Veranda) covered in 16th century frescoes- a fantastic setting for mealtimes. A good selection on offer for a continental style breakfast, although no fruit. Breakfast may also be taken alfresco in the courtyard, which was lovely. The staff are polite and friendly throughout the hotel, from reception to chamber maids. For a historical building, it is exceptionally clean and tidy and very well presented. Our bedroom was extremely comfortable, and furnished in keeping with the period of the hotel. We had the most fantastic view of St Peter's Basilica over the rooftops- being on the 4th floor is definitely a good thing here, and there IS a lift However, it would have been nice to have tea and coffee making facilities in the room, although there is a minibar. The bathroom was small but well equipped, with complementary slippers, toileteries, sewing kit, tissues and emery board. The towels were lovely and soft and big enough to wrap yourself in. Some reviews have said that the rooms are basic, but I think that bearing in mind the historical age of the building, and the fact that it was a monastery for many centuries, the conversion to a hotel has been done very sympathetically.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Classic European feel”
Reviews.Author: Hawknoid
Reviews.Content: My wife and 6 year old daughter just returned from a 4 night stay at the Columbus and we really liked it. No, it is not a modern typical American style hotel, but for our trip to Europe that's not what we wanted. The room was clean, though fairly stark in decor, but we did not go to Rome to sit in our hotel room all day. The fun of staying at the Columbus was walking down the old stone stairway and through ached hallways surrounded by antique art objects. The breakfast room was fantasitic with a soaring ceiling and amazing frescos painted all around. There is a nice patio with a fountain which was a nice place for breakfast or a drink at the end of the day. The best feature of the hotel is the location. It is steps from St. Peters and directly across the street from hop on / hop off buses which can take you to all the sites in town. The neighborhood is very quiet in the early morning and later in the evening which makes the hotel a little bit of a retreat from all the hustle and bustle of the narrow Rome streets. If you stay here, make sure you get up early around 6 and take a walk to St Peter's before the crowds arrive. You will have the square to yourself which is a memorable expericence.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - depressing decor”
Reviews.Author: ptc-mama
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be near the Vatican, and this is about as close as you can get. But then it's a bit far to the rest of the sights in Rome. The hotel is gloomy and depressing, though spacious. We had just arrived after spending 4 days at the AVA Hotel in Athens, so we had been spoiled. The breakfast was really nice, but the room decor and the bathroom were downright medieval. Air conditioning was great as it was really hot in Rome, but internet barely worked. This place could be an awesome property with some updating and redecorating, but as it is, it's a downer. The laundry price list in the room was still quoting lira, that's how long it's been since anyone paid attention to details. My daughter (aged 11) loved the big casement windows opening out onto the courtyard, where she could sit and read.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: James_Canaan
Reviews.Content: Really close to the St Peter square was the best of the hotel. The rooms are not so nice but comfortable and clean, mine was roomy, big enough for a family of 4 (my son is 3 years old though). The breakfast was also good. I think is a good deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Grand exterior but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: mandcw
Reviews.Content: A lovely looking hotel, very close to the Vatican and a good walk into the centre of town. We were very impressed when we arrived at the Columbus's grand entrance and reception, but the staff are a bit flat and disinterested to be honest, we didn't find any great hospitality about the place. We had 2 rooms and both were a disappointment. When the doors to the lift opened on our floor everything looked a bit tired and the rooms were worse. This is an old building steeped in history but one that needs a good revamp throughout. Our rooms were basic with a tatty bathroom. On two seperate days we were without hot water for a few hours. When we called reception they weren't very helpful but the problem got fixed eventually. The cleanliness of the rooms wasn't up to scratch and everything just seemed a bit grotty. One night it was chilly so we put the air-conditioning unit on to warm up our room. This, we think, brought back to life some dormant mosquitos as that night we became a tasty meal - something we didn't expect in October! Breakfast was in a very grand room, but cold buffet style and slow service on the tea and coffee front. We didn't eat dinner there, we went over the road, through an archway where there's a street full of restaurants. Rome itself, as you would expect is fantastic, but we would stay elsewhere next time. If you want to be in the hub-bub then this hotel is too far out of the centre but still a nice location if your main reason for visiting Rome is to spend time at the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, the best hotelvisit in Italy.”
Reviews.Author: Haaland
Reviews.Content: I got a bargain offer on internet for this hotel, and it was such a treat!Front desk staff always greeting courtiously, and the halls and stairs are really sleek and keeping a very authentic style. The room I got was, I suppose, among the hotels cheaper rooms. But it's size was surprisingly big for one, with wellkept furniture and a big closet. Granted, the bathhroom was a bit quint. The breakfast serving is rather good, at least for th usual standards of Italy. When it comes to location, Rome is a tricky town. It is not possible to stay close to everything at once. That being said, this hotel is offers a rather handy alternative. It's in a safe area, and ofcourse on the doorstep to one of the biggest attractions of Rome. Overall, I am very pleased with my 4 night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: mango_candy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a good area and is relatively comfortable. The staff however are rude, ill mannered and have no concept of treating their guests with respect. They did not offer to help with my luggage when I arrived, kept reminding me when I had to check out and lied to my parents when they called me at the hotel- told my parents I was not there when in fact I was. I was very disappointed with their service and would not recommend staying there unless you don't care about poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: Emma10Surrey
Reviews.Content: Lovely unusual hotel. Clean, nice basic room. Nice breakfast. We walked everywhere. No need for buses/tubes! Wear comfortable shoes. We had our meals out in the local restaurants. Don't dress like tourists...this is a smart city! Sunday morning service in Vatican is on TV, relayed on a tannoy outside the bedroom window, or better still, come out of hotel, turn left......walk for two minutes and watch it live! Best holiday I've had. Beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel right next door to St.Peter's Basilica”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyJEnfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Columbus Mar 7-10, 2009. The hotel is located 200 yards from St.Peter's Basilica. You can walk (25-30 mins) to the centre of Rome, e.g. Trevi Fountain, but may need to get a taxi back, as it can be tiring. A taxi would cost circa 15 Euros one way. An alternative is to buy a hop on/off bus ticket - the buses stop right across the road from the hotel. Haggle for a 48-hour ticket - we got ours (19 Euros each) for the same price as the 24 hour ticket. At night, the area around the hotel is very quiet, with limited restaurants in the streets opposite the hotel. Again, it may be an option to walk to the centre for dinner and getting a cab back. We didn't try the hotel restuarant for dinner as it looked like it would cost circa 70 Euros per head. Our room (416) was spacious and clean, and looked out onto the central courtyard - so was also very quiet. The continental breakfast was excellent and sets you up for the day! The staff at the hotel were always friendly to us - I often find that being polite and friendly yourself pays dividends! Overall, we had a very pleasant stay and my only reservation over using this hotel again would be its non-central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but hotel lets itself down”
Reviews.Author: HectorSussex
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that the location near the Vatican is wonderful. It is a good 30 minute walk though, from the restaurants area (Travestevere) and you need to cross the river for other main sites i.e. Colosseum, Trevi fountain etc. so make sure you have good walking shoes. As said in previous reviews, the hotel lets itself down which is a real shame. Staff as helpful as they want to be. The rooms are small , dark, very basic and in need of refurbishment. One can imagine what it was like for the original monk occupants. Brighter light bulbs would help. Our room fronted onto the road leading to the Vatican which you could see when leaning out of the window. The double mattress was excellent though, being memory foam I think. You do need to take your own kettle or hair dryer. Floors are tile only so take slippers. Only 2 English channels on rather old TV, BBC 24 news & CNN news. Breakfast disappointing and appeared done for cheapness. No hot cooked breakfast available to set you up for the days sightseeing. There is internet wifi in the bar area if you have a laptop or 2.5 euros per hour for use of hotel internet computer (x2). Meals in Rome are very expensive and seemed to be pizza & pasta only. A lunchtime small cheese & tomato roll and coffee 10 euro each! A slice of pizza 8+ euros but then we were in the centre of Rome. Vatican museum is 14 euros to go in so we gave that a miss. Ideal hotel perhaps for religious groups visiting Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in the Vatican area of Rome”
Reviews.Author: DaveM241
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in Rome - a city neither my wife or I have ever visited before, and the Hotel COLUMBUS was one of the recommended hotels on Airmles website. We backed up the Airmiles blurb with our own research and booked the Columbus for a 3 night stay. The hotel is easy to get to fom the Metro, a 10 minute gentle walk on the flat. The first impression is the convenience to St Peters Square and The Vatican - about 200yards from the front door ! The receptionist was very helpful and polite on booking in. The room was not especially large, but did have a very big bed and was spotlessly clean (room 322) The view from our window was straight onto the Via Conciliazone, which is quite a major road. I thought we might have a disturbed sleep from the road noise, but the secondary glazing was more than up to the task of keeping the road noise out. The bathroom was small but again spotless. The staff were all very helpful, very polite and always smiling. The breakfast was substantial and very good for a continental style meal. We did not eat at the restaurant as it was quite expensive, as is the bar whch we did use. There is a street about a minutes walk from the hotel ( Borgo Pio) which has a very good selection of restaurants, Pizzerias and family run eating establishments, all of which were better value than the hotel. The hotel is directly opposite the bus stop or the bus tours. All in all a charming hotel with masses of character and was more than adequate or our needs. If we ever go to Rome again, and we are planning to, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - Read if you are considering.”
Reviews.Author: pmhslight
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hotel Columbus from Sept 13-19 2008 and before choosing this hotel I did extensive research. I have never been to Rome before and I traveled with a female friend. We were looking for a good hotel that was close enough to everything and also had some Italian / Roman charm to it. What we were not looking for was your everyday american "sheridan or Hilton" type hotel. Let me start by saying the location is excellent. The hotel is probably 3000 feet from St. Peters Basilica, The Vatican Museum, and maybe 10000 feet from St. Angelos Castle. From the Hotel we walked to the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Novenna, Spanish steps, and just about every other attractions. For the Collosseum, it is maybe a 20 -25 minute walk or you can simply walk to the subway station (5 minute walk) and take it to Termini Station, then get on the B line and take it 2 stops to the collosseum. Another thing we found very helpful was the fact that directly across from the hotel was the Hop on Hop off tour busses. You can buy a 24 hr pass or a 48 hr pass for 19 or 23 euros a person and basically use the bus as a cab taking you all around the city and stopping where you feel like or riding up top and seeing the whole city for an hr or two. Definitely worth the money. We didnt take a taxi once, except to get to the airport on our last day since it was an early flight. Room: I read alot of mixed reviews and was somewhat nervous, but once we arrived in the room, it was absolutley fine. We stayed in a double bed in room 410. The room was cozy, with a small window looking out towards St. Peters Basilica. The bed was a little springy but overall no problem. The bathroom, while very small shower (VERY SMALL) was very very clean and nicely tiled. There was an inroom safe and a TV that got 2 english channels. All of the front desk staff were helpful except one rather grumpy person. I didnt pay any attention to him and it did not affect our stay at all. They all spoke english very well and were helpful when we asked about how to get places etc etc. The resturant was very expensive and we chose not to eat there. There are more then ample places around the city to eat. At night time the street infront of the hotel becomes a ghost town as the vatican city pretty much closes up. Thats no problem as when you walk out of the hotel go to the right, walk for 2 minutes over the bridge and your right in the city of rome with lots to do. Its actually really nice to come back to the hotel at night and have it be nice and quiet and peaceful. I would consider it more of a plus that it is quiet outside at night. The continental breakfast that is included is ample to get you through the morning and a good part of the day. There is cheese, salami, bread, cereal, juice, and some other "interesting" stuff. Defintiely worth it as other hotels charge 11 euro each and more if you go outside. There is also internet for 2 euro an hour (very good deal). Overall I highly recommend this hotel, even if you are "not looking for a spiritual location". The hotel is centrally located. Depite what the maps show, everythign is VERY close in Rome and you can walk just about everywhere. I have photos of the room and hotel and will try to post them later as I do not have them on me. I would defintiely stay at the hotel again. And as a point of reference, I am in my late 20's as is the female I traveled with. We have traveled extensivly and have good taste and do not like cheap or crappy hotels. This was defintiely not cheap or crappy and for european hotels, I was again, impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LucyRabb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Columbus for 3 nights in the middle of August 08. It is in a great location in central Rome - right opposite the Hop On Hop Off open top bus tour of Rome bus stop and 2 minutes from the Vatican yet in a quiet area across the River Tiber. Only 10 minutes walk to the Metro station. The staff were not very helpful but friendly enough. We booked a twin room but were given a double. The double was basic and dark. We then asked for a twin room, and it was no problem to change. The twin room was far nicer - bigger and brighter - Room 310. Must admit - there was weird banging that woke us up every night - we assumed it was either decorators working in middle of night or our neighbours arriving - but realised on the last night the noise went on too long and too late. Spooky! We strongly recommend a meal in the garden restaurant of the hotel - it was the best meal we had in Rome! You need a travel kettle and hairdryer for the room but there was handy mini bar/fridge. There is a drinking water fountain just outside the hotel which is great for re-filling your bottles of water - the water is safe to drink and very refreshing! A word of warning - there is a pavement restaurant a few metres down towards the river on the same side as the Hotel. Got green table clothes. Awful food and very expensive. If you cross the road directly across from the hotel and walk through the back streets towards the Vatican 'Wall' there are cheap tasty pavement restaurants there which were very nice. Love Rome - must go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: London9000
Reviews.Content: I assume that anyone giving a negative review of this hotel has never stayed in a European capital city before. $500 a night will get you a good hotel in a bad location or a bad hotel in a good location (we have stayed here a few times and pay around $300 depending on season). It is a bit frayed at the edges (small tv, small shower, small lift - what do you expect in a 15th century palazzo - they can't exactly pull a few walls down) but for the money you will be hard pushed to beat it. It is close to the centre - very good for the Vatican and St Peters, 45 minute walk to the Forum, but does not suffer the constant noise of being near Piazza Spagna, Via Veneto, Termini, centro storico etc. Don't expect 5 star luxury, but you will be hard pressed to get better for the money - unless you want to stay outside of Rome (e.g. EUR). Quiet, good location, plenty of bars and restuarants are walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ucsbqueenie
Reviews.Content: I presume you are going to stay at this hotel because it is very very old and want to see and experience some of the history of the area. If you are not here for the history or location - don't stay here, you will be very dissapointed. The hotel is clean but spartan. I asked for a large room (like in the photo provided by the hotel) with a view of the Vatican. I got a very small room but did get a view of the Vatican. The bed was extremely uncomfortable, lumpy and very soft. The desk service was not what I would call friendly. It was more of a "neutral" state. No smiles, the crew just went through the motions. The breakfast was good and you could fill up well on it . They had cereal, fruit, cold cuts, hard boiled eggs, bread, pastries, juice, coffee, milk and teas. If you want cappuchino or expresso, you must ask the server and she will go make it. The rooms you can visit are worth seeing, old frescos and oil paintings are certainly a site. Overall the hotel was OK. I am not sorry I stayed there but I wouldn't stay there again. My recommendation woul be to stay there a couple of days and then move on to another hotel. It is one of those, "once is enough experiences". Patrick - California

Reviews.Title: “great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LondonUna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the columbus with my two teenage daughters and I was slightly concerned that we might be too far away from all the major sites. This was not a problem atall. You can see the vatican from the hotel and all the other sites are all reachable if you enjoy a good walk. We were all pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The building itself is very impressive, wide staircases and paintings. The bedrooms definately need an overall and the bathroom needs a complete refurbishment. The breakfast and breakfast rooms were lovely and the staff were helpful and friendly. Definately value for money.

Reviews.Title: “I was robbed at the Columbus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: operagurl
Reviews.Content: I was robbed inside this hotel by the minibar man. Sounds crazy I guess, but he took all of my euros, pounds and checks. I complained to the hotel manager who didn't even seem to care and implied I was making the story up. Luckily it happened the last night I was there, otherwise it would have been extremely akward. When I went down to breakfast with my friend, we were robbed, we came back and saw the man leaving our room, I even saw his uniform, and I recognized him from the night before--he kept starring at my expensive libretto laptop. I suspect that was what he was looking for, but since I had it on me he only found my money. My door was even unlocked when I came back to the room, I had so much proof at what happened, and the manage still refused to believe me, saying that he has known his staff for years and years. When I got back home, I notified expedia and the police, and also a police report was filed in rome, even though the manager didn't see a point to calling them. Other than this, my stay in Rome was fine. But I will NEVER go back there!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaVin
Reviews.Content: A decent hotel, rather old, but that's what makes it average. It's architecture is wonderful, as well as its art and grand dining rooms. But, the sleeping rooms need quite a bit of updating. The room rate was good and the daily breakfast was quite good. The dining rooms have a great old world charm. The staff is incredibly friendly, gracious, and warm. There are a lot of very good small restaurants in the adjacent neighborhood but you have to cross the Tiber to get to the major areas of the city. However, if you're looking for easy access to the Vatican, then this is the place to be based. It's a very safe area that is very busy during the day and very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL Hotel, This is the Place to Stay...”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl024
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four nights during our honeymoon, and absolutely loved it! We arrived at the hotel, and our bags were promptly escorted to our room for us. The hotel is has a heavy, antique decor to it, nice paintings, and is very clean. We had reserved a junior suite, and were very pleased with the room. The living room and bedroom were decent-sized; though the bathroom was somewhat narrow, it was still comfortable and inviting nonetheless. The staff were quite friendly and spoke a fair number of languages. They also had a breakfast room and separate restaurant serving lunch and dinner, both of which were quite good. The breakfasts offered milk, tea, coffee, and various juices as well as an assortment of breads, fruit, cereal, sliced meat, coffee cake, etc. It was all light, but quite filling and always tided us over during our mornings of sight-seeing. Their restaurant was WONDERFUL, and served a number of appealing dishes; we enjoyed the staff and food so much that we usually ate there for dinner. However, the downside of the restaurant is that it is quite pricey and towards the weekends is often full. The biggest problem that we had at Hotel Columbus was that the internet service was quite unreliable and cost 1 euro per hour. This isn't a business-oriented hotel really, it is much more accomodating to couples and families than anything else. The second problem we found was that it was quite a ways from the airport, and so cost about a 44 euro taxi ride. Other than the Vatican, this hotel is not immediate to any major Rome attractions, so expect to spend money on taxis!
