The best part was stepping outside the hotel and seeing the Vatican just a short walk down the street. The view of it is phenomenal! Anyone primarily interested in the Vatican and museums should definitely stay at this hotel. But anyone who is more interested in night life will probably not enjoy the location of this hotel; the area around the Vatican is very quiet at night, though the trattorias and pizzerias stay open fairly late. Overall, there is not much to do in the evenings other than eat and walk. But the area is very safe, and we did this almost every evening of our stay. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome, and plan on staying there again on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Specialty Location”
Reviews.Author: Beau69
Reviews.Content: If your prime reason for visiting Rome is The Vatican, then this is the place for you. Step out the front door, turn left and in 5 minutes you are there. If your interest lie elsewhere in Rome, I would suggest something more centrally located. Taxi fares are prohibitive and public transportation is confusing at best.

Reviews.Title: “Get a feeling for Rome”
Reviews.Author: Khonsu
Reviews.Content: The stay, ambiance and location would put this hotel as an "Excellent". To be true to other hotels in regards luxury, facilities, extras it does not come with these. By no means a criticism. In fact, it would detract from the very reason we chose the Columbus in the first place. Visiting several websites, viewing pictures etc we could see that it was not a luxury hotel but that it would be more in keeping with the location - ie next door to the Vatican and the Castel San T'Angelo. The welcome was very warm, despite my best attempts at providing the worst italian ever. Very organised and we were in our room with luggage in around 5 minutes. The lift has a capacity of 4 people. We were on the top floor (4th) and decided to use the stairs on every occasion. Particularly draining after walking about 10miles a day around Rome. Again, our choice so no complaints. The room is cleaned every day with fresh towels. Very clean, very basic but all the essentials (except an iron). The view from the room was of the top of St Peter's Basilica above the roof tops - amazing. The bathroom had bath, separate shower and was roomy. The TV in the room only had one English speaking channel, BBC World, so if with children be prepared for that. The breakfast included was fine. All the basics there for a continental breakfast. It was lovely to sit on the veranda at breakfast. As with all things in Rome, eating and drinking around the main sites is expensive (a beer 8euros), walk around and there are plenty of choices. When we go to Rome again, we will stay at the Columbus.

Reviews.Title: “loved every minute at columbus”
Reviews.Author: debalinabalerina
Reviews.Content: ive been to rome before but this time the experience was completely different. the hotel staff were so friendly. i was a little concerned before checking in after reading reviews but as a travel agent i will be telling everyone about this fab hotel! the location is fantastic. literally on the vatican doorstep. allesandro on reception is fantastic. we initially stayed for one nite, travelling onto southern italy the following day but we travelled up to rome twice after this for a few days..each time staying at the columbus, the staff remembered us and were willing to do whatever it took to make us comfortable. my mother is terminally ill with cancer and i had my 11 month old son with me but the staff helped as much as possible. the only real negative was the fact that the cot we got was broken, ie my son pushed the side and it fell off! lol. and when we requested a new one, it was ten times worse..the next two times we went they gave us triple rooms instead as they had no cots so im guessing they were all broke! lol. but, the management sent us up a bottle of wine for the trouble which was a lovely touch. the breakfast was by far the best out of all the hotels ive been to in italy and the breakfast room itself is utterly breathtaking. the atmosphere and history surrounding the building is worth its weight in gold and the merc service to the airport is well worth the little extra. 40euro by taxi but only 50euro for the hotel merc service. i will definately be heading back to this fab hotel! and as for the lift being too small, its really not! i read that a few times on here! i managed to fit a big pram and my mother and myself so it does the job and adds to the atmosphere. love to all at the hotel columbus hehe thanks for an amazing stay!! deborah murray

Reviews.Title: “not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: csevilla
Reviews.Content: I write this because I feel it is important that people should know how a person was affected by the hotel they stayed in. For location, this hotel is great. You are three minutes to the Vatican. That it is an old castle with frescoes is also true, but the management of the hotel should upgrade its rooms. They are so old and tired. The TV is vintage 1980 and was not functioning half the time I was there. The room safe broke down everyday, the dyer fell apart when I tried to use it. There are no shower curtains so you flood the bathoom each time you bath. The sheets are of the poorest quality and the blankets have holes. I stay inside my hotel room a lot. I tour at day day time, and relax in my room at night. It was not pleasant. This is not a 4 star hotel. At the most you can rate it a 2. They charge too much for this kind of facility. Conchita Sevilla, Madrid Spain

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidwebster300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Columbus last summer with friends and absolutely loved it. I just love all its history and the location....well, that speaks for itself really doesn't it. It's just breathtaking walking out of your hotel in the morning and seeing the Vatican. The hotel includes a buffet breakfast which I found an adequate start to the day. There were numerous breads, cheeses and meats, or cereals and fruits. We were a bit naughty and took a supply of fruit out with us each day in case we got peckish. The rooms were a bit on the small side but I can say that for every European hotel I've stayed in so that's not an issue. The balcony was a nice touch: it's just nice to stand out there and watch the world go by. The hotel's a bit of a walk to the nearest underground (about 10-15 mins) but that wasn't really a problem. There's not much in the way of dining in the area so we headed over the river each evening. If you cross the bridge and walk down Corso Vittorio Emanuele II, you have two amazing Piazzas to choose from: Piazza Navona and Campo de'Fiori. We went to these every night and were never disappointed with the food or the ambiance All in all, this is an amazing hotel and I wouldn't hesitate on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: JoandMel
Reviews.Content: After doing research into overseas hotels, I was a little worried at the standards we would come across. Columbus Hotel was fantastic. Great rooms, comfortable bed, great bathroom and most of all, clean. Negatives - didn't realise most hotels do not have irons available (this hotel did not have one at all!!), 2) It was very warm on the 4th floor and not allowed to have air con on!! I could live with those negatives because the room was spacious and clean!! @ min walk to St Peter's Basilica and close to fantastic train system.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome--wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: GandMWash
Reviews.Content: The review is a bit late, but things've been a whirlwind since my husband and I honeymooned in August.... Overall: -stunning aesthetic...it's like visiting a palace (there are frescoes on the wall of the dining room, lovely corridors) -great location...steps from St. Peter's and less than 10 minute walk to subway -we felt safe walking around at night -front desk people were quite helpful Rate: We got a good rate through the hotel website about three months before our vacation, discount b/c of a 5+ night stay/early booking discount. We paid $160/night. I think the regular rate is almost $300. About Us: We 26, lawyers from Wash, DC, honeymooned in Rome/southern Italy, and are classical history nerds. We wanted a hotel with character that was conveniently located for exploring. I love having the pictures of the hotel to look at. If you want something other than a Hyatt/Hilton generic hotel, want a place with character, the Hotel Columbus is wonderful. It's a converted 15th century palace and very well preserved. I am glad we opted to stay here rather than at one of the little boutique hotels. The Room: It was one the small side, by U.S. standards (who sits in their room all day in Rome,though??) It was meticulously clean. There was air conditioning and a nice big window that overlooked the courtyard. Food: -breakfast: We ate a big breakfast everyday in the lovely, tree-lined courtyard. Cereal, bread, coldcut/cheese, yogurt, juice, coffee, water...pretty good for pre-sightseeing sustenance. -hotel restaurant: we had one dinner there, nothing special, and not cheap! My advice is to avoid it and go discover a real Roman meal somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Experience history”
Reviews.Author: PierfromVenice
Reviews.Content: I chose the place thru my guidebook. I was afraid the price would have been +300 € but then got an offer at 140€ (true - it was mid-january when there are few tourists around). The hotel is an old patrician palace once owned by the Della Rovere family - the family of Pope Julius II - the warrior Pope. The ceilings have affrescoes. I had a huge room with classic furniture. For once I broke my principle of not eating in the restaurant of a hotel where I stay and went to have diner in the Columbus restaurant. Quite an experience as I was alone. Which gave me the occasion to ask some information to the butler. I understand the palace is owned by the Vatican state and sometimes used to house some distinguished visitors such as Fidel Castro who once had a discreet meeting with John-Paul II in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: zekUk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a weekend in Rome, including the hotel, through Expedia. It was our first trip to the city and it was brilliant. The Hotel Columbus is in a fantastic location and we walked everywhere - The Collaseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and all the places in between. The Vatican is only a couple of minutes walk, you can see it from the hotel. Throroughly recommend walking around the city, you see so much and get a real feel for what Rome is about. We really liked the hotel and all of its character, the breakfast was nice, though nothing special, and we had a really relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: Roger1960
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The location of this hotel could not be better. It is located less than 100 metres from the Vatican. ROOM: The room was clean but small, nevertheless it met the needs of my wife and I. It also has a safe for your valuables, the use of this is free. RESTUARANT: The restaurant is expensive but has a good menu. INTERNET: There is access to the Internet via two Apple Mac PC's but you will have to stand to use them as there are no seats and they are situated in the hotel lobby. There is a Wi-Fi area but this is situated in the Hotel bar. There is no Internet access in your room. FOOD: Breakfast is good but continental. ACCESS: The lift is very small. My wife although not wheelchair bound has to use a wheelchair. It was very difficult to get the wheelchair and my myself in at the same time. STAFF: Very helpful and had no problems. There were 8 in our party and they managed to order an MPV to take us to the airport. Overall I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family it's location is excellent for eating out and late night walks. My visit lasted from the 7th to 9th November 2006

Reviews.Title: “will not stay here next visit”
Reviews.Author: MikeSant
Reviews.Content: very ordinary and plain. not freindly when we arrived. We booked though expedia. when we arrived they had our name and reservation on file but insisted that we have a copy of interary from expedia. I explained that when I went to print vouchers on the expedia web site no voucher printed for the hotel . there was none . the only vouchers was for a tour we booked at the same time. the person behind desk finally let us check in, this was my wife and I. he told us we could get him a copy later of our itenerary from expedia. The next day I found the hotel had internet in the loby that you can stand at as there are no chairs to sit. The cost is two euros per hour. not alot of money but why not give for free as hotel cost is expensive. After I learned how to log onto internet, not easy as I dont read Italian. I went to expedia web sight and called over same guy behind front desk that checked us in I showed him that there was no voucher to be printed to check into hotel ,the guy told me I needed to cut and paste and print that page with hotel info on it. I said do you have a printer ,he said no I would have to go a few bussisneses down the street and there was an internet cafe with avalible printer. Wow I was not happy. I have checked into many hotels with ID and credit card and never this hassel. The resturant was nice but very expensive. We will not stay here again. Also hard to get taxi at night to other places in town.

Reviews.Title: “Would Choose a Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnierW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Columbus Hotel Sept 13-16, 2006 with my mother, aunt and cousin. It is an old hotel with alot of Italian ambiance and charm in the public rooms. However, the general consensus of the 4 of us was that the rooms, standard double with 2 twin beds which is what we had, left a lot to be desired. The room was very small, barely enough room to move around and very little space to put two suitcases. One suitcase had to sit on the floor next to the bed blocking access to the armoire. The bathroom was modern enough but the shower was extremely narrow. The accommodations are far from luxurious but are adequate if all you are looking for is a bed to fall into after a day of sightseeing. The airconditioner was okay but needed to be on all day in order to make the room barely comfortable in the evening. The weather was warm and a little humid and a better airconditioner would have been nice. Our room was off the courtyard so it was quitet enough to open the windows in the evening and listen to the fountain. Very nice and peaceful. The Continental Breakfast was fabulous and dinner was very good although pricey. The internet connection in the lobby is slow but adequate enough if all you want to do is check your email and send messages to everyone at home. The hotel is also just across the street from many of the Hop On Hop Off Tour bus stops a definite plus. My mom is 75 and my aunt 83 so the walking to and from the Basilica or the bus stops wasn't exhausting. There are several restaurants within walking distance and little bars where you can grab a sandwich, soda or gelato. The best thing is the proximity to St. Peter's Basilica and the Vatican. You literally walk out the front door and you can see the Basilica which is a 5 minute walk. If you stay here upgrade to a suite or room larger than the standard it would be well worth the extra cost. Keep in mind what Americans consider a 3 or 4 star hotel is not the same in Europe. I WILL return to Rome, but I will choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend Hotel Columbus”
Reviews.Author: pixted
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Columbus 27-30th September, 2006. It was with some concern I booked this hotel having read some of the reviews, but as my travelling companion is visually impaired it seemed the most convenient location, being only a few yards from St. Peters square/vatican museums. We were delighted with our room which was quite spacious for the two of us [3 single beds], sufficient hanging space, very clean room/bathroom, and a view of St.Peters from the window. If you book this hotel, you must be aware that you are booking a 15th century palace, and 500 years ago, rooms were not large/light. If its chrome, glass and the latest plumbing you want then this hotel is not for you. But the hotel has the charm of a former palace, not over decorated with pictures, artefacts etc. just very natural. Breakfast had a wide selection of healthy food, cereals, good bread, cheeses, meats, pastries etc. My companion also has coeliac disease, and staff were more than happy to refresh gluten free bread/croissants etc. and it was lovely to sit in the garden area at breakfast time. Reception staff arranged a taxi to the airport, at a much more reasonable charge than that incurred on the journey in from the airport. Tour buses operate across the road from the hotel, at the time of our visit bus 110 tour of rome, 2hours for 13 euros very good value with commentry in 8 languages. Try to be in the queue for the Vatican Museums by 8.45.a.m. if you cannot - leave your visit until 12.30.p.m. [depending on opening times] would recommend food in the vatican cafeteria. Also Piazza Risorgimento has some reasonably priced restaurants. We would definitely return to the Columbus and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and more!”
Reviews.Author: dcdeb
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, 14 year-old son, and I) stayed at the Columbus for four nights at the beginning of July and had a wonderful experience. The room was spartan, but quite clean, comfortable, and a good size for a triple, and we loved the old world atmosphere of the whole place. The bathroom was very clean, with a few unexpected amenities, like paper slippers. Front desk staff was a bit stand-offish at first, but as soon as I tried to speak a little Italian, they became quite friendly and helpful, giving us tips on where to go and how to get there (we were there during a taxi strike!). We used the in-lobby internet access without any trouble -- it was nice to be able to check email and send a few messages home. The location of the hotel is beyond belief -- literally steps from the Vatican. If we leaned out our window, which overlooked the Via della Conciliazione, we could see St. Peter's! It's also just a few minutes to Castel Sant'Angelo, and a little bit further away is the Piazza Navona. We walked just about everywhere without a problem from this terrific location. Breakfast featured fruit, cold meats and cheeses, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, rolls, cereals, juices, and coffee -- no complaints there at all. You could sit inside, in the gorgeous dining room, or outside in the garden. We dined one night in the hotel restaurant, La Veranda, which was excellent -- although it was very expensive. Overall, I'd highly recommend a stay at Hotel Columbus for the traveler who wants a centrally located, moderately priced hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: bryzo
Reviews.Content: Monastic, classy, not luxury but functional. buffet breakfast a bit sparse if you do not eat healthy. Resturaunt expensive but very 5 star. lots of eating places nearby. all tour buses stop outside and service buses at the bottom of the road. forget the metro! you do not see Rome pass by on the underground. Travel by bus or walk. It is a very walkable city. Located 30 seconds from Vatican city. Go to St. Peters before 8am and see the priests at work. I went every afternoon while my wife had a nap. The vatican museums are a small walk away and close at lunchtime. To be honest the Sistine Chapel looks better from the top of St. Peters. At the bottom of the street is the castle. A MUST! it is superb. Stay at this hotel, it is very Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the window in our room we had a great view of St. Peters Basicilica and the Vatican. The hotel was quaint but extremely comfortable. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was absolutely wonderful. If i go to Rome again, i'm staying at the Columbus again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Columbus - false advertising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Hotel Columbus because it advertised internet access available from most rooms. I had an extensive (several hour) project to complete. When I arrived at the hotel, the desk clerk was occupied with a women reporting that her credit cards had been stolen out of her room. When I finally arrived in my room, there was no internet access available, though a wireless area was available in the downstairs bar. The elevator was out of service and several of the clerks were rude. The bartender couldn't make a decent mixed drink to save her life. This hotel is rated as four stars! My recommendation would be to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lgp49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Columbus, Via Concialiazione, Rome for 5 nights in mid May 2006. It's a great location for the Vatican, and it's also close to Castel SantAngelo. It's not a bad walk to Piazza Navona, Campo Fiori, Pantheon and Spanish Steps. Nice room although the air conditioning didn't work too well and the beds were bouncy but hard. We found all beds in Italian hotels to be similar, even in the Courtyard Marriott by the Rome Airport which is brand new. Staff was pleasant and there is a bar-tabacchi right outside run by a couple - husband from Boston and wife Italian. Good coffee and beer and sandwiches. Only thing not close by were decent restaurants, but we were usually willing to walk over the bridge and find one elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Like living next door to the Papa! Superb Columbus a real Palace.”
Reviews.Author: mwin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my 90 year old mother and two sisters. Beautiful location literally yards years from St. Peter's on the main avenue and the hotel is full of character, history and warmth. This is not a modern hotel but has to be experienced from tree lit gardens at night, wonderful restaurant/ breakfast room with paintings from floor and all of the ceiling. Check the rooms upstairs also for a real piece of history. The staff were curteous, friendly and very helpful at all times and our pre-arrival request for adjoining rooms was done. Well done Columbus.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Columbus because another hotel we had booked was not able to accommodate us and refered us to The Columbus. It was a last minute thing and we did not have time to look for anything else. Needless to say we were aghast at the price but felt we had to take it. We arrived in Rome by train from Florence and took a taxi to the hotel...35 euro. It was an amazing sight as we drove up to see St. Peters just steps away. It really blew us away. Over the course of 3 days we spent a great deal of time in Vatican City... The hotel is over 500 years old and has lots of history.. The front desk was friendly and helpful. The rooms are sparce , no frills.. and no pictures on the wall. The double decker sight seeing bus was available across the street, which made it easy for us to see the other famous sites of Rome. All in all a great experience but very expensive.... P.S. When we were looking for lodging we toyed with the idea of staying by the airport as there were several hotels available in that area.... Do Not Book a hotel room by the airport if you are sight seeing....All roads may lead to Rome, but the road is several miles away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Easter”
Reviews.Author: RO888
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Rome. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We were sorry to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A real roman holiday!”
Reviews.Author: akarit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Columbus with my family this March, and I must say that I found this Hotel to be a true gem! We first wanted to stay closer to the Spanish Steps, as our last time in Rome about 6 years ago, but couldn't find anything available due to some kind of local patron saint celebration. Hotel Columbus was the only available choice we found, and eventhought a bit pricy, it is well worth the stay: Set in an old monastery, a stone throw from St Peter, this is a Hotel with charm and caracter, that gave us a cocoon of peace, beauty and tranquility for our entire 4 nights stay. I would reccomend this Hotel to anybody and surely will come back to it next time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in January and were very pleased. The Hotel was elegant and location was perfect. The staff was courteous and professional. Our room was nice size and the bathroom met our request. Our bed could have been bigger, but that's Rome! Our windows faced St. Peter's and was a highlight. Breakfast was good, especialy the service and setting. I highly recommend the restaurant. The atmosphere and quality of food was tremendous. I will stay at this Hotel on our next visit to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great Hotel! Would definitely recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: pupasina
Reviews.Content: I have just been to the Hotel Columbus and I found it fabulous: the rooms are a good size for european standards, very clean, the staff is quite friendly and helpful and the location cannot be beaten. I will surely come back to the Hotel Columbus and would recommend it to others. Arrivederci!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Columbus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from our first trip to Rome, we stayed in the Columbus Hotel. I was a bit concerned after reading some negative reviews, however we enjoyed our stay. Our room was a double en-suite; it was functional and comfortable, the window overlooked the courtyard and the top of St Peter’s Dome could be seen above the opposite roof (we were on the 3rd floor). Although I tried hard to speak my phrase book Italian most of the staff seemed to understand me and/or speak English. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. We took our evening meals in the hotel; although not cheap it was very enjoyable. It cost us 180 Euros in total for the two meals; each night we had 2 courses each, a bottle of house red (very very nice) and coffees, plus a tip. We found the 1st course from the menu, very filling. There are without doubt less expensive, good quality places to eat in Rome, this was just a treat. We also used the taxi service to the airport at the end of our stay, it cost 50 Euros to Ciampino, and again we thought it worthwhile value. Let’s face it, when you're in Rome you’re not going to want to spend much time in your hotel, especially if like us you’re on a short break; we found the Columbus ideal, it was secure, friendly, comfortable and ideally located. Overall we were happy and would certainly use the hotel again.
